Info from literature:
Har vært brukt som irritasjonsdempende middel ved blærelidelser, da i form av en emulosjon. Videre har drogen vært brukt som galledrivende middel, til fremstilling av fet olje, og som fuglefrø.
Planten er forbudt å dyrke (Droger avd. C). Biological activity: antiasthmatic, antiepileptic, antitumor, antibacterial, antianxiety, analgesic, hypnotic, tachycardia, hallusinogenic, embryotoxic. Traditional use: sedative, to treat dyspepsia with painful symptoms, cancers, ulcers, migraine, neuralgia, rheumatism (3). Parts of plant used: leaves. Medicinal use described in (4). Chemical composition: hundreds of different compounds have been isolated from hemp. The most interesting constituents are the cannabinoids: present in the leaves, and consentrated in the bracts and the resin. The chief representatives of the cannabinoidgroups are: tetrahydrocannabinol (THC), cannabinol (CBN), cannabidiol (CBD). The activity of hemp is based on THC alone. THC is particulary lipophilic, and is rapidly absorbed. It binds to specific reseptors in the brain. Therapeutic potential: antiemetic activity (observed on canser patients undergoing chemotherapy), antiglaucoma, antiasmatic, anticonvulsant, spasmolytic and analgesic properties (5).

The papaya latex obtained by incision of the fruits short before maturity, contains a mixture of enzymes possessing proteolytic and esterase activities (papain, chymopapain and papayaproteinase). In therapeutics, a purified fraction, chymopapain, is often used for the treatment of sciatica due to herniated lumbar disc. Papain, alone or in combination, is proposed for the therapy of digestive disorders, and in dietetics, as an agent to relieve gastric or duodenal insufficiency such as post-prandial disorders or bloating. It is used externally and locally in antiinflammatory preparations. It can also be used in contact lens cleaning liquids (1).

The nutmeg is mostly known for its essential oil  (5-15%) chiefly composed of terpenoid hydrocarbons alongside with fairly small amount of alkylbenzenes. The volatile fraction has an effect against platelet aggregation, which is linked to eugenol and isoeugenol, despite their low consentration. These molecules are inhibitors of cyclo-oxygenase, and inhibit prostaglandin synthesisin different tissues, including the mucosa of the colon. Eugenol also has an antibacterial properties. The psycotropic activity of nutmeg (euphoria, hallucination) seems linked to myristsinand closely related products. Several cases of intoxication following ingestion of high doses (5-15g) have been reported (3).

Opium is the latex collected from the capsules. The active prinsiples are represented by 10-20% alkaloids. Morphine is the most abundant alkaloid (10-12%). Morphine exerts its effects by binding stereospecifically, reversibly, and with high affinity, to the specific reseptors found mainly at various levels in the CNS. The CNS activity includes: analgesic, resporatory and other Central Effects, but also dependence. Codein has an antitussive activity, and is also a potent analgesic, but with a much less intense action than morphine (3).
